page.title: 12FRECKLETON MUSIC FESTIVAL
page.content: Freckleton Music Festival originated in 1939 thanks to the efforts of County Councillor Richard Spencer M.B.E. who to this day in the cornerstone of the festival.He not only performs much of the prelimanary work but is there,his white carnation in his button-hole, introducing all the items and adjuidicators.Musicians and choristers come from all over the Northwest and Yorkshire to take part in this village prodution,indeed choirs from Wales have performed here competing with others from other parts of England.Only the top adjuidicators are invited as judges and high standards of music must be attained for a choir or solo artist to achieve a prize.Strike Lane C.P. school has won the "Iddon Trophy" for junior school choirs for the past three years.
